cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SSW of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW but forecast to slow, turn NW across central-western Cuba, emerge into the Florida Straits, track northward along or just inland of the U.S. Southeast coast and accelerate northeastward off the Mid-Atlantic coast late Wednesday-Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near or just north of Tampa Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for eastern Cuba; Tropical Storm Watch for Florida Keys Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas (no watches posted north of Florida yet)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning southern Haiti; Tropical Storm Warnings Haiti coast, Jamaica, and much of eastern–central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas, extending northward to the Mid-Atlantic shoreline (including southeastern Virginia)
weather_observation.wind: Best current guidance gives a 13 % chance of sustained 34-kt (39 mph) winds at Norfolk; peak gusts 35–45 mph possible late Wed night–Thu morning as Elsa passes inland to the west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: With Elsa remaining weak and moving inland south of the Chesapeake Bay, only minor surge of 1–2 ft above normal tides is anticipated.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy showers possible but current outlook suggests generally 1–3 inches; localized 4 inch totals cannot be ruled out in bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls reducing visibility, elevated seas and hazardous rip-currents beginning late Wednesday; port operations may need to secure container yards and schedule vessel movements accordingly.
